result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James D Patrick-Yance

records.addlTxt:
11:45am Court in session

Defendant James Patrick-Yance present in court, in custody with attorney Brad Lochowicz. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Victim, J.F. appears in custody via video

Atty Lochowicz was just appointed on both files yesterday afternoon.

Felony case is set for jury trial on Monday, unknown that Atty Lochowicz would be prepared to proceed to trial on Monday
Deft has demanded speedy on the felony matter

Court asks Deft questions

Court goes off the record for scheduling

Parties have agreed upon trial dates, speedy trial 

Initial appearance on 22CM579, reading of complaint waived
Not Guilty Plea entered & trial reserved at this time, Court will set status hearing to track the final pretrial in the felony case. 

Victim questions why he is considered a victim on the CM case, makes further statement
Court informs J.F. he can file paperwork with DA's office with his concerns


11:57am Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Patrick Yance present in court, in custody via video with attorney Jason Daane. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Daane has conflict with the victim on this case & will need to withdraw on the felony case.

SPD will appoint on this case. 

Court will set status for next week
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Signature bond filed, defendant refused to sign bond.

Called at 1:37 PM. Defendant James D Patrick-Yance in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared for bond purposes. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Discussion as to bond. Bond applies to this file only. Court date remains for 22CF403. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
